required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Study to Assess the Immunogenicity and Reactogenicity of High Versus Standard Dose TIV
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study to Assess the Immunogenicity and Reactogenicity of High Versus Standard Dose Trivalent Inactivated Influenza Vaccine for Healthcare Workers

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this pilot study is to assess the immunogenicity and reactogenicity of Fluzone High Dose with Fluzone (standard adult dose) influenza vaccines in healthcare workers.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, randomized controlled, observer blind trial of Fluzone High Dose trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (HDTIV) versus Fluzone, standard dose TIV (SDTIV) in 100 healthcare workers 18-64 years of age. Participants will receive, in a 1:1 ratio, one dose of either SDTIV or HDTIV containing the strains of influenza virus as recommended by the World Health Organization for the season of recruitment. All adverse events will be collected for 7 days following the injection, serious adverse events will be collected through day 21, and serum for antibody testing will be obtained on day 0 and day 21. The primary outcome will be seroconversion to each strain of vaccine included in the vaccine, as measured by change in hemagglutination inhibition assay (HAI) titer between day 0 to day 21.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Seroconversion to A/California/07/2009 (H1N1)
primary_outcome.description: Seroconversion to influenza strains contained in the vaccine, as measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HAI) assay. 4-fold or greater increase.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Seroconversion to A/Texas/50/2012 (H3N2)
primary_outcome.description: Four-fold or higher rise in titres to A/Texas/50/2012 (H3N2) as measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Seroconversion to Influenza B/Phuket/3073/2013
primary_outcome.description: Four fold or higher increase in titres to B/Phuket/3073/2013 as measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Seroconversion to A/Switzerland/9715293/2013 (H3N2)
primary_outcome.description: Four-fold or higher rise in titres against A/Switzerland/9715293/2013 (H3N2) as measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Seroconversion to B/Massachusetts/02/2012
primary_outcome.description: Four fold or higher increase in titres to B/Massachusetts/02/2012 as measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Ratio (GMFR) Against A/California/07/2009 (H1N1)
secondary_outcome.description: GMFR (mean fold increase) time2/time1, as measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay
GMFR (mean fold increase) time2/time1, as measured by HAI titres
GMFR (mean fold increase) time2/time1, as measured by HAI titres

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Ratio (GMFR): B/Phuket/3073/2013 Ether-treated
secondary_outcome.description: GMFR (mean fold increase) time2/time1, as measured by HAI titres

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Ratio (GMFR): B/Massachusetts/02/2012 Ether-treated
secondary_outcome.description: GMFR (mean fold increase) time2/time1, as measured by HAI titres

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Adverse Event: Injection Site
secondary_outcome.description: Any local adverse event following immunization,self reported in daily diary Includes the maximum values for any one of: redness, warmth, swelling, or bruising

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Adverse Event: Systemic
secondary_outcome.description: Any systemic adverse event following immunization,self reported in daily diary Includes the maximum value reported for any one of: myalgia, arthralgia, headache, malaise, fatigue, weakness, sweating, shivering, or feverishness Defined as: None: Not at all Mild: Present, but did not interfere with activities Moderate: Interfered with activities, but didn't prevent them Extreme: Prevented activities

arm_group.description: Fluzone High-Dose® Licensed for use in the USA in persons ≥ 65 years of age as a single dose of 0.5 mL containing 60μg hemagglutinin per virus strain
Fluzone ® Licensed for the prevention of influenza as a single dose of 0.5 mL containing 15μg hemagglutinin per virus strain for adults

group.title: High Dose Fluzone
group.description: Fluzone High-Dose® Licensed for use in the USA in persons ≥ 65 years of age as a single dose of 0.5 mL containing 60μg HA per virus strain Fluzone High-Dose: Influenza vaccine Either 2014/15 OR 2015/16

group.title: Fluzone (Standard Dose)
group.description: Fluzone ® Licensed for the prevention of influenza as a single dose of 0.5 mL containing 15μg HA per virus strain for adults Fluzone (standard dose): Influenza vaccine Either: 2014/15 OR 2015/16

group.description: Fluzone ® Licensed for the prevention of influenza as a single dose of 0.5mL containing 15μg HA per virus strain for adults Fluzone (standard dose): Influenza vaccine

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Seroconversion to A/California/07/2009 (H1N1)
outcome.description: Seroconversion to influenza strains contained in the vaccine, as measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HAI) assay. 4-fold or greater increase.
outcome.population: A blood sample from one participant was hemolysed and not available for analysis

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
